rComments: I have a lot of affinity for this professor - she's a very funny, kind, and smart person. Her material is clearly conveyed, and she makes the topics interesting. Her tests are completely fair, the essay/observations have plenty of preparation and guidance involved, and the attendance was a no brainer because the class was so good. A must-take.

don't take this class unless you hate yourself. she won't let you skip section (if you miss one you fail) unless you are dying and while you are dying you managed to get a doctors note. guess who gets to go to section and infect everyone with the stomach flu instead of just staying home!

Su Hua was a very solid lecturer.  Closely followed the slides, which were very similar to the book.  In lecture, she would make it apparent what was most important for the test, so make sure you go to class!  She's also easily approachable for any questions.

Su Hua was nice, but her lectures lacked structure and were a bit confusing, because she didn't use any powerpoints or notes, she did not have any exams, but her quizzes were difficult, and her TA was an unfair grader.

Such a nice professor! Her class is very easy to follow because she lectures with such enthusiasm! As long as you come to class and pay attention, you will do great in her class!  Even if you don't attend the lecture, 3/4 of the slides are online! She only tests on thing mentioned in class and in the reading assignnents in the book. Great class!

She is an amazing teacher. Take her if you can. You don't really need to buy the book, but it's a must to go to all the classes. Don't copy friends notes becasue it won't help you. If you go to class and take good notes you will pass the class.

As long as you go to class and take notes and memorize the notes you will get an A. Just make sure to take the tests seriously and not just look over the lecture notes, but acutally memorize stuff like ages and theories. Other then that it's pretty easy and she is an amazing teacher.

Great teacher! The tests were only slightly difficult. As long as you attend lecture and take notes, you'll be fine. We barely used the book. Overall, she's a great lecturer. Very clear, ready to answer questions, and has great examples to help our understanding. I think she's on maternity leave soon, but I hope I get to take an upper div from her!

The exams/midterms are very easy and only require review of the lectures and some review of the book. I never had the book and did just fine. She's funny and lecture isn't boring. As long as you attend lecture/review the power points on your own, you'll do fine

Little use of text book, tests are heavily based on lectures. Make sure to take good notes, pay attention to details. Honestly, I thought her exams were not difficult at all- they were pretty much straight from the lecture notes. She was very sweet and was extremely knowledgeable about her subject.
Great teacher! Very nice and knows her stuff!! Class isn't to difficult if you go to lecture!! Tests are mostly on lecture so go to lecture!! I would recommend taking this class!

Tips: go to lecture no matter what, take really detailed notes, pay close attention to study guide, ask questions in class, always go to section, write essays days before they are due. do not underestimate this class.

she looks sweet and acts nice and cute in lecture, but really she is not. She tests from her slides so make sure you go to class. You don't need buy the book, just make sure you take good notes.  Oh, her short answer questions come from the research articles.

She tries very hard to make it a good lecture and it usually is but like someone said before her exams have some really ridiculous details and she doesn't really curve. I mean we didn't have ANY A's in our class and only 3 A-'s... I don't think that's fair for an introductory psychology course.

Su-hua is a wonderful teacher and individual. If you want to learn from her and you take the inititive she is very responsive. She is serious and dedicated about her subject so her classes are not a super easy A, but you will learn!

Su-Hua looks sweet and small, but looks can be deceiving.. Grading wise: everything is taken from lecture SO GO! She attempts to make things easy for students, and in that way she's a good professor. Unfortunately, she's more and more inapproachable as the quarter goes on. Recommended for those who don't speak up in class. (But she learns names..)

Prof Wang is an OK prof, but I have personally had way better Dev. psych profs at UCSC.  She is very focused on trivial details in exams, causing students to lose sight of what is important, and she writes poor tests. If you have to take her course, luckily there are good upper-div developmental courses to cover for her ineffective teaching.
She is so cute and friendly. Class is not super easy but it is fair and engading.
She is a great teacher, cares about her students and it shows. Very friendly and approchable.
Test questions are 90% taken from lecture! She is nice and has a sense of humor.

She is a good teacher, she talks about the studies she is doing and I found that really interesting. Most of her lectures parallel the book, read b4 class and you'll be fine. Her tests' wording is sometimes confusing due to the language barrier, but if you ask for clarification she is very helpful.

She's great.  She has a good sense of humor and her material is straight forward. If you show up to every lecture and section, you'll do fine.  She even limits the reading to the material talked about in lecture.  Even with an accent, she's the best psych teacher i've had.
very excited regarding the subject she is teaching, but hard to understand, has a policy of not curving any tests, tests were unorganized.

Very excited about the topics she lectures on.  Her accent can be a little confusing, but it only requires careful listening to understand what she's saying.  Do the required work and the class isn't difficult.  Good professor overall
Hard tests, lame videos, sometimes not very good at explaining things
